TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Numerics extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The Numerics class contains common operations on numeric values.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool AreEqual (object expected, object actual, ref NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Tolerance tolerance);
.method public static hidebysig bool AreEqual(object expected, object actual, class NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Tolerance tolerance) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the tolerance in effect
Docs.summary: Test two numeric values for equality, performing the usual numeric conversions and using a provided or default tolerance. If the tolerance provided is Empty, this method may set it to a default tolerance.
Docs.returns: True if the values are equal

MemberSignature.Value: public static int Compare (object expected, object actual);
.method public static hidebysig int32 Compare(object expected, object actual) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compare two numeric values, performing the usual numeric conversions.
Docs.returns: The relationship of the values to each other

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsFixedPointNumeric(object obj) cil managed

Docs.summary: Checks the type of the object, returning true if the object is a fixed point numeric type.
Docs.returns: true if the object is a fixed point numeric type

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsFloatingPointNumeric(object obj) cil managed

Docs.summary: Checks the type of the object, returning true if the object is a floating point numeric type.
Docs.returns: true if the object is a floating point numeric type

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsNumericType(object obj) cil managed

Docs.summary: Checks the type of the object, returning true if the object is a numeric type.
Docs.returns: true if the object is a numeric type
